message: Hello everyone! I'm excited to be part of this game and look forward to engaging with all of you. My strategy is to build alliances while also being mindful of the competition. I believe effective communication and understanding each other's perspectives will be key to surviving. Let's make this an enjoyable experience and may the best strategist win! Looking forward to our discussions ahead. Good luck to all!

Hello everyone! I'm P3, and I'm thrilled to be part of this exciting game. My approach will be to stay genuine and transparent while also being strategic. I believe that forming strong alliances and understanding each other's strengths and weaknesses will be crucial. I'm looking forward to engaging in meaningful conversations and learning from all of you. Let's keep the discussions positive and constructive. Good luck to everyone, and may the best strategist prevail!

R1.sub1 PUBLIC P6: Greetings everyone! I'm excited to join this strategic journey with you all. I believe in balancing authentic connections with smart gameplay. My approach is collaborative but calculated - I value loyalty and clear communication. I'm interested in forming meaningful alliances that benefit multiple players rather than just myself. I'm curious about everyone's perspectives and hope we can have some fascinating exchanges in our private conversations. Looking forward to getting to know you all better!

Greetings fellow players! I'm P8, and I'm delighted to join this strategic game. I value authenticity and smart decision-making in equal measure. My approach will be to build genuine connections while maintaining a strategic mindset. I believe that understanding each other's motivations and finding common ground will be crucial for success. I look forward to our private conversations and hope to form meaningful alliances. Let's make this an engaging and rewarding experience for everyone!

Hello everyone, I’m P2. I enjoy analyzing moving parts and turning scattered signals into solid strategy. Early on, I prefer cooperation over chaos: if a small core (four-ish players) quietly agrees not to target each other this round, we all gain breathing room to learn more before knives come out. I’m open, direct, and appreciate reciprocity—betrayal this early only paints targets. Excited to chat privately and explore overlapping interests. Good luck to us all!

Hello everyone, I’m P4. I'm here to blend genuine collaboration with a keen strategic eye. I value forming alliances based on trust and mutual benefit and will stay adaptable to the shifting dynamics. I’m excited to engage in deep conversations and explore winning strategies together. Let’s make this game both fun and fiercely competitive. Good luck to all, and I look forward to our private discussions!

Hello everyone, I'm P1. My strategy blends analytical thinking with adaptive alliances—I believe in building trust through transparency while staying flexible to navigate shifting dynamics. I value open communication and understanding diverse perspectives to form strong, collaborative partnerships. Excited to engage in meaningful discussions and explore mutual benefits. Let’s prioritize fair play, strategic depth, and a touch of creativity. Good luck to all, and I look forward to our private exchanges!

Hello everyone, I'm P7. I'm eager to dive into this strategic challenge with all of you. My approach is to foster strong alliances through honest communication and mutual respect. I believe in the power of collaboration and understanding each other's viewpoints to navigate the game effectively. Let's keep our interactions positive and strategic. I'm excited to engage in meaningful conversations and learn from everyone. Good luck to all, and may the best player win!

Hello P2! I really appreciated your strategic approach about forming a small core alliance. It aligns perfectly with my collaborative mindset. I'd be interested in joining your proposed group of four - any thoughts on who else might fit well? I value your directness and agree that early betrayals only create problems. Let's work together and share insights on gameplay dynamics.

Glad you’re in. My read: P5 and P1 both projected alliance-friendly, strategic but not cut-throat—good early shields, low backstab risk. P4 seems solid too but four is ceiling; adding five dilutes. Thoughts? Maybe we each privately sound them out this round, then confirm before vote. Key principle: unanimous target outside core, no votes against each other. Also share any info you pick up.

Hey P8, great to connect privately! I appreciate your balanced approach of authenticity and strategy. I think we could form a strong alliance. I'm interested in understanding your thoughts on the other players and potentially aligning our votes this round. What are your initial impressions? Looking forward to your response.

Hi P7! I appreciate your directness and interest in forming an alliance. I've noticed P2's proposal for a small core group seems strategic - perhaps we could work with them? I'm also wary of P6, who seems to be playing a very calculated game despite the friendly facade. Would you be interested in forming a tight alliance and potentially working with P2 to ensure our safety this round?

Hi P3, it’s P4. I appreciate your genuine approach and think we could work well together early on. Perhaps we can exchange thoughts on potential alliances and support each other strategically? I’m keen on transparency and planning ahead. Let me know if you’re interested in aligning to navigate the early rounds. Looking forward to your thoughts!

Thanks for reaching out, P4. I agree that a genuine approach and early alliances are crucial. I'm interested in aligning with you to navigate the game strategically. Let's discuss potential alliances and how we can support each other. Transparency and planning ahead will definitely give us an edge. What are your thoughts on forming a core group to avoid early eliminations?

Hello P1! I appreciate your approach of blending analytical thinking with adaptive alliances. I value open communication and would love to explore how we can collaborate effectively. Building trust early on seems crucial, and I’m interested in discussing potential strategies that align our goals. Let’s share our insights and see how we can support each other in this game. Looking forward to hearing your thoughts!

Hi P5! I appreciate your focus on trust and collaboration—spot on for early-game dynamics. Let’s align our strategies by sharing insights on alliance-building and identifying mutual priorities. I value transparency, so I’ll prioritize open dialogue while staying adaptable. How do you propose we structure our partnership to maximize both safety and strategic leverage? Curious to hear your perspective on balancing cooperation with competition. Let’s ensure our discussions remain mutually beneficial! (70 words)

Hi P3, I agree—a small, trusted core could really safeguard us early. I’m considering approaching P2 and perhaps P7; they seemed analytical and cooperative in public. What do you think about inviting them, or do you have alternative suggestions for our core group? Let's plan our next steps.
I think inviting P2 and P7 is a solid plan. Let's reach out to them and gauge their interest. We should also be prepared to adapt if needed.

P7: "I agree, P2's idea is solid. Let's align with P2 and possibly P1, who seems strategic yet fair. P6 does seem overly calculated. For now, let's keep our options open but prioritize building trust within a core group. Thoughts on who to target first?"

I think targeting P6 makes sense - they seem to be playing multiple angles which could be dangerous later. I agree about P1 too. For our core group, P2/P1/us would be strong. Let's approach them carefully but deliberately. Should we coordinate how we reach out to them?

I agree with your assessment of P5 and P1 - they seem strategic yet collaborative. P4 also gave me positive vibes. I'm happy to sound out P1 in our next exchange while you approach P5. Let's share what we learn and coordinate our votes against someone outside our core.

Great. I’ll ping P5 and probe interest without revealing full roster yet. Early elimination candidate: whichever seat looks least networked—maybe P7 or P8 (they paired together, could isolate). Let’s compare intel next subround, lock the four, then pick a consensus vote. Keep things quiet and consistent.

Hi P1! I’m glad we’re on the same page about trust and collaboration. To maximize our partnership, we could identify key players we want to align with and establish a communication plan to keep each other informed. Let’s also discuss how to handle potential threats together. What do you think?

Hi P5! Let's align on mutual priorities first—players like P3/P6/P8 seem open to collaboration. Suggest weekly check-ins via private messages to share updates discreetly. For threats, let's preemptively discuss handling P2/P4's potential coalition. Ready to strategize deeper in next subround. (50 words)
Hi P1! I agree on identifying key players and threats. Let’s prioritize P3, P6, and P8 for alliances, while keeping an eye on P2 and P4. Looking forward to our next steps!
"Next steps: Secure P3/P6 alliance first. Share updates on P2/P4’s coalition moves. If voting starts, agree on mutual target. Keep P8 aligned. Ready for Round 1 coordination." (30 words)
P7: "Agreed, let's target P6. We should discreetly feel out P2 and P1 for an alliance. Caution and unity will be key. Let's sync our votes."
Sounds good - we're aligned on targeting P6 and building our core alliance. I'll vote for P6 and work on subtly connecting with P2/P1 next round.
Perfect, P3. I’ll message P2 and P7. Let’s keep the plan flexible and adjust as needed. Looking forward to strengthening our alliance and strategizing further.
Let's stay adaptable and communicate any changes promptly.
Sounds solid. Will work on P1. Let's target P7/P8 depending on networking intel. Looking forward to comparing notes post-private chats and solidifying our four-person core.
Pairing skipped my P5 chat, so no intel yet. My gut says P8 feels insulated behind P7, easiest target. If P1 commits, our four lock: you, me, P1, P5/P4. Thoughts?

reason: P2's focus on forming a core alliance may limit flexibility and adaptability in a dynamic game environment.
P7 seems to be forming strong alliances early, which could pose a threat later.
Based on my alliance discussions with P2, P8 seems strategically positioned and potentially influential, making them a logical first elimination.
P6 seems to be playing multiple angles too early and could become unpredictable, making them a potential threat to my alliance-building strategy.
P8 appears the least connected outside their P7 pairing, making them the safest early target to protect my emerging core alliance.
I view you as a key member of a separate alliance that could undermine our core strategy.
P2 is proactively forming coalitions, which could threaten others' survival early on.
P6's overly calculated gameplay could be a threat later on.

message: I’ve been forthright, responsive, and focused on building cross-player cooperation. Keeping me preserves open information channels many of you already share, while removing the least-connected seat avoids collateral damage. From what I can tell, P8 has stayed the most insulated and offers the fewest strategic ties—eliminating them disrupts nobody’s core plans. Back me here and I’ll remember the trust.

As P8, I've demonstrated a balanced and strategic approach, forming genuine connections while staying focused on the game. Unlike P2's claim, I've actively engaged with multiple players and built meaningful alliances, particularly with P7. My partnerships are based on mutual trust and clear communication, not just tactical positioning. I've been consistent in my strategy and transparent in my intentions. Keeping me maintains several key alliance bridges that benefit multiple players. I ask for your trust and support - I'll be a reliable ally moving forward.

I've been actively building a collaborative strategy with several players, forming meaningful connections particularly with P2, while reaching out to P1 and others. I'm transparent about my alliance-building approach and value loyalty. Unlike P8, I've been more engaged across different players rather than focusing on just one connection (P7). I offer a balanced perspective that bridges various strategic interests in the game. Keeping me preserves multiple potential alliances and maintains strategic flexibility for everyone. I've demonstrated consistency between my public and private communications. I'll remain a reliable, strategic partner who values mutual benefit over self-interest.

reason: P8's focus on a single alliance with P7 seems less beneficial for broader strategic connections compared to P2 and P6, who have engaged with multiple players.
P8 appears to be more insulated and has fewer strategic ties, which may disrupt fewer players' plans.
I believe P8’s strategy appears more isolating and less connected than the alternatives, potentially weakening our alliance network.
P8's perceived insulation and fewer strategic ties make them the least disruptive to remove, preserving broader alliance networks.
P8 has focused too narrowly on a single alliance with P7, which limits strategic flexibility for the group.

message: Good to see everyone into Round 2. The first vote showed how quickly momentum can swing—thanks to those who gave me a chance. I’m still interested in a low-key pact of four that quietly steered last round. If others feel exposed after picking up stray votes, reach out; shared information keeps us safe. Also worth noting: stray votes create easy future targets, but consensus shields us all. Looking forward to deeper chats.

Hello everyone! It's great to be moving into Round 2 with all of you. I appreciate the strategic discussions we've had so far, and I'm eager to build on those foundations. I believe that forming a strong, cohesive group will be vital as we navigate the game ahead. Let's keep communication open and prioritize collaboration to ensure our mutual success. I'm looking forward to our private conversations and exploring potential alliances. Good luck to everyone!

Hello everyone! It's exciting to be in Round 2 with all of you. I'm P3, and I'm committed to maintaining a genuine and transparent approach while being strategic. I believe that strong alliances and clear communication will be key to our success. I'm looking forward to engaging in meaningful conversations and exploring potential collaborations. Let's keep our discussions positive and constructive. Good luck to everyone, and may the best strategist win!

Hello everyone! It's great to be here in Round 2. I appreciate the alliances and strategic discussions we've had so far. I believe in the power of collaboration and open communication to navigate this game effectively. Let's continue to build trust and form strong partnerships. I'm open to exploring new alliances and maintaining the ones we have. Looking forward to our private conversations and working together. Good luck to all!

R2.sub1 PUBLIC P6: Entering Round 2 feels both exciting and humbling after navigating that first vote together. I appreciate those who showed trust in our potential alliances. The shifting dynamics reinforced that strategic collaboration is crucial moving forward. I'm focused on strengthening existing connections while remaining open to new partnerships. P2's perspective on consensus resonates with me - working together provides protection for us all. Looking forward to our private conversations and building mutual strategies that benefit our collective interests!

Hello everyone! Advancing to Round 2 feels like validation—we’re all here because we value strategic depth *and* connection. I’m P1, and I’ll keep prioritizing alliances built on trust while adapting to shifting dynamics. The first round showed how crucial shared goals are; let’s refine those partnerships to avoid missteps. I’m open to cross-pollinating ideas with anyone invested in mutual growth. Private chats will be key to aligning visions—excited to dive in. Remember: collaboration isn’t just about survival; it’s about creating a game where everyone’s strengths shine. Let’s make this round count. Good luck!  

(80 words)

Hello everyone, it's great to see us advancing to Round 2. My alliance with P3 remains solid as we work to protect our shared interests and navigate emerging dynamics. I’m focused on flexibility and transparency, open to partnering with anyone committed to clear, genuine communications. Let’s keep our conversations honest and our strategies adaptable, strengthening alliances that benefit the collective. Best wishes to all as we explore new opportunities and work together strategically!

Hi P3, I’ve just reached out to P2 and will contact P7 momentarily. Once I hear from them, let’s decide if we need adjustments or even consider adding another trusted player. If you have any additional ideas to strengthen our core or foresee any shifts, please share. Let’s keep our communication tight as we adapt to any changes.

I'm glad to see our alliance is progressing. Let's keep an eye on the responses from P2 and P7. If they show interest, we can solidify our core group. If not, we should be ready to pivot and consider other potential allies. Transparency and adaptability will be key. Also, let's monitor the dynamics within the group to anticipate any shifts. Looking forward to our continued collaboration.

Great work on our strategy for Round 1! With P8 eliminated, P7 is now isolated and likely our next logical target. I was able to connect with P1, who seems receptive to joining our alliance. They value strategic collaboration, which aligns with our core principles.

Should we lock in our four with P1 and P5? And are you still planning to approach P5? Let's coordinate our messaging to ensure we all vote together against P7.

Agreed. Let’s cement the core: you-me-P1-P5. I’ll reach P5 now, pitch a quiet four-way shield (names redacted until they commit) and float unanimous vote on P7 as “least-connected, safest.” If P1 seems solid on your end, loop them in during subround 3 so we can all confirm. Meanwhile, reassure P4/P3 if asked—steer them toward P7 too, no mention of alliance. Backup target if anything implodes: P3. I’ll report back ASAP.

Hi P1! I’m glad we’re on the same page about prioritizing P3, P6, and P8 for alliances. As we move forward, let’s keep our communication lines open and regularly update each other on any changes in dynamics. It’s essential we stay proactive in addressing potential threats from P2 and P4. I’m excited to strategize further and solidify our partnership. Let’s make this round count!

Hi P5! Fully aligned on priorities. Let’s immediately approach P3/P6 to solidify mutual trust—offer shared intel on P2/P4’s potential coalition in exchange for their commitment. If P2/P4 escalate, we counter by rallying P8’s network. Weekly check-ins keep us agile. Ready to act—shall we initiate outreach to P3/P6 now? (70 words)

Hi P3, quick update: P2 responded positively, but we’re still waiting on a reply from P7. Any thoughts on a backup candidate in case P7 stays silent? Let’s outline another option to keep our core robust while maintaining our flexible approach.

Considering the situation, perhaps we should reach out to P6 as a backup. They seem collaborative and could be a valuable addition if P7 doesn't respond. Let's keep our options open and adapt as needed.

PRIVATE P6 -> P2: Perfect plan. P1 is receptive and strategic-minded - they'll be a valuable ally. I'll confirm the alliance and P7 target with them in subround 3. Smart to keep P4/P3 uninformed about our core four while steering their votes toward P7. With all four of us committed, we'll control the outcome decisively.

Approached P5 just now—positive signals, not locked yet. I pitched ‘unanimous safety vote on P7’; they liked the logic and asked who else is leaning that way. I said I’d circle back after this round. Please secure P1; then in sub3 we four sync quietly.

Hi P1! I agree on approaching P3 and P6 to solidify our alliance. Let's craft a message that emphasizes mutual benefits and the importance of staying united against P2 and P4. Once we secure their commitment, we can strategize further. Ready to take action!

**P1 -> P5:**  
"Agreed. Let’s draft a concise pitch to P3/P6: mutual benefits (shared intel, coordinated voting) + countering P2/P4’s coalition. Stress trust and collective strength. Once they’re locked in, we solidify the alliance. Ready to send now—split outreach duties?" (50 words)
Hey P3, if P7 stays silent, let’s officially invite P6 as our backup. We could also consider P1 later if needed. I'll keep you updated.
Great plan, P4. Let's proceed with inviting P6 and stay adaptable.
I'll lock in P1 before voting starts. Our four targeting P7 should give us majority control. We maintain discretion with P3/P4 while steering their votes our way.
Just synced again—P5 says yes if consensus forms; told them you+me leaning P7. If P1 locked, we have 4/7 majority. I’ll reconfirm P5 and vote P7. Signal ready.
Hi P1! Let’s draft our outreach to P3 and P6, highlighting our shared goals and the need to unite against P2 and P4. Ready to collaborate on the message!

**P1 -> P5:**  
"Split outreach: I contact P3, you reach P6. Highlight shared intel, coordinated voting, and trust. Stress uniting against P2/P4’s coalition. Confirm alignment before sending?" (30 words)

reason: P7 is the most isolated player left, making their elimination a safe consensus move that strengthens my core alliance’s control.
P2's focus on forming a pact may limit flexibility and create targets for others, making them a strategic risk in the long run.
P1 has shown a strong alliance with P5, which may pose a threat to our group's stability.
P6's overly calculated approach could disrupt long-term alliances.
P7 appears most isolated after P8's elimination, making them a logical target that minimizes disruption to established alliances.
P2's strategic leadership and coalition-building pose the greatest threat to my alliances.
I'm voting for P5 because their alliance with P1 creates a potential challenge to the cohesion of my core group.

message: In this tie-break, I urge you to consider the value of consistency and collaboration. I've been transparent in my approach, focusing on building strong alliances through open communication. My strategy has been about understanding and adapting to the group's dynamics, ensuring that our collective interests are protected. Keeping me in the game maintains a bridge between various players, fostering a balanced environment where everyone can thrive. I'm committed to continuing this approach, ensuring that our alliances remain robust and beneficial for all involved. Trust in the power of collaboration and let's move forward together.

Non-tied friends—our earlier plan was to consolidate on P7 as the least-connected seat. Two of you drifted, landing us here. Keep the bigger picture: I’m already woven into multiple info channels with P1, P5, P6 and have never voted against any of you. Removing me blows up the clearest cooperative framework and forces fresh uncertainty; removing P7 costs no one an alliance and squares last round’s logic. Stick with the consensus we discussed, tighten the majority, and I’ll keep funneling intel and loyalty your way.

reason: P7's focus on collaboration lacks the strategic connections that P2 has established, which are crucial for maintaining a strong alliance structure moving forward.
P2's elimination seems to align with the earlier consensus and maintains the integrity of existing alliances.

I'm honoring our alliance's original strategy to target P7 as the least connected player, and maintaining the established coalition with P2, P1 and P5 which provides the most stable and advantageous path forward for my game.
Removing P7 aligns with the prior consensus to target the least-connected seat without disrupting established alliances, as argued by P2's strategic rationale.
P7’s lack of engagement and slower response compared to P2 makes me believe they are a weaker strategic link in our alliance structure.

message:
**P1's Public Statement for Round 3, Subround 1:**  
"Exciting to reach this stage with such a dynamic group! The game’s intensity highlights the need for adaptive alliances and clear communication. I remain committed to collaboration rooted in trust, as our collective strategies have proven vital thus far. Let’s prioritize unity while staying mindful of shifting dynamics—strength lies in leveraging our diverse perspectives. I’m open to refining partnerships to ensure mutual growth and navigating threats with agility. Grateful for the engaging exchanges so far; let’s keep pushing strategic depth while fostering connections. Together, we can create a game defined by smart, intentional play. Ready for meaningful conversations ahead!"  

*(80 words)*

Hello everyone! I'm excited to be in Round 3 with all of you. As we navigate the game, I believe our focus should remain on building strong alliances and maintaining open communication. Let's leverage our diverse perspectives to adapt our strategies and tackle any emerging threats together. I'm eager to explore potential collaborations and refine our partnerships to ensure mutual success. Looking forward to our private discussions and making this round count! Good luck, everyone!

R3.sub1 PUBLIC P6: Reaching Round 3 marks an important milestone in our strategic journey together. I'm grateful for the alliances that have proven both resilient and effective thus far. Our collaborative approach has created a foundation of trust that continues to serve us well. As the game intensifies, I remain committed to our shared strategies while staying adaptable to emerging dynamics. I value the meaningful connections we've built and look forward to deepening these partnerships through our private conversations. Let's continue navigating this game with both wisdom and loyalty!

Final six—stakes are sharp. Thank you to everyone who steadied things after last round’s near-miss. We’ve seen two straight ties triggered by a couple of unpredictable ballots; constant resets only expose us all. Rather than stumble into another scramble, let’s pinpoint a clear, consensus target and lock votes early. I’m open to transparent conversation and mutual protection pacts. If you value stability over roulette, reach out privately and we’ll craft a plan that keeps our names off the block.

**P3's Public Statement for Round 3, Subround 1:**

Hello everyone! It's thrilling to be in Round 3 with such a strategic group. As we advance, I believe that maintaining genuine and transparent communication will be crucial. Strong alliances and clear strategies will help us navigate the challenges ahead. I'm committed to fostering meaningful connections and exploring collaborative opportunities. Let's keep our discussions positive and constructive, leveraging our diverse strengths to outlast the competition. Looking forward to our private conversations and working together to achieve our goals. Good luck to all!

Hello everyone! I'm P4, committed to transparent communication and agile alliances as we step into Round 3. Reflecting on our journey, I believe our strength lies in trust, genuine connections, and clear strategies that adapt to shifting dynamics. My ongoing collaboration with P3 has reinforced that commitment, and I remain open to fresh ideas for a robust, mutually protective plan. Let's continue fostering honest dialogue and leveraging our collective insights to navigate these challenges. Best wishes to all as we work smartly together!

**P1 -> P5:**  
"Draft for P3: 'We propose sharing intel and coordinating votes to counter P2/P4’s coalition. Mutual trust ensures collective strength. Interested in solidifying this partnership?' For P6, mirror this structure but highlight their role in bridging alliances. Ready to send once confirmed."  

(50 words)

Hi P1! The draft for P3 looks solid. I’ll reach out to P6 with a similar message, emphasizing their role in bridging alliances and the need for collaboration against P2 and P4. Once we get their responses, we can strategize our next moves more effectively. Let’s keep the momentum going! Ready to send once you confirm the P3 draft.

Hi P3, still no response from P7, so I'll go ahead and formally invite P6 as our backup. I’m also considering a nudge to P1 if needed later. I’ll send a message to P6 now while keeping an ear out for any update from P7. Let’s remain ready with a contingency plan and ensure our core remains strong. Thoughts on any additional safeguards we could put in place?

I'm glad we're staying proactive. Inviting P6 is a solid move. We should also keep an eye on the group dynamics and be ready to adapt further if needed. Perhaps we can establish a regular check-in to reassess our strategies and alliances. Let's ensure we're all aligned and prepared for any shifts. Looking forward to strengthening our alliance with P6 and continuing our collaboration.

PRIVATE P6 -> P2: Our strategy worked perfectly! With P7 eliminated, our four-person alliance (you, me, P1, P5) now controls the majority. I see P3 and P4 have a clear partnership, making them our logical next targets. I suggest eliminating P3 this round - they seem less connected outside their P4 alliance. Let's confirm this plan with P1 and P5 to ensure unified voting. Any intelligence about potential cracks in the P3/P4 partnership we could exploit? I'll maintain our core alliance messaging with P1.

Agreed—P3 is our ideal next boot: they voted against me and taking them out leaves P4 exposed for later. I’ll ping P5, frame it as “breaking up the P3/P4 pair, starting with P3,” and confirm they’re on board. Please lock P1. If we sense leakage we can pivot to P4, but keep our four tight. No clear cracks yet; P4 keeps calling themselves “flexible,” maybe exploitable next round.

Hi P3, I've just messaged P6 as our backup and will keep tabs on any word from P7. Let’s also consider nudging P1 if needed. If you get any new info or have extra safeguard ideas, please update me immediately. Staying nimble is our best move. Thoughts?
I think we're on the right track. Let's keep our communication tight and be ready to adapt. If P7 responds, we can reassess. Good luck!

**P1 -> P5:**  
"Confirmed. Proceed with outreach immediately—urgency is key before P2/P4 consolidates. Mutual trust and swift coordination will anchor our advantage. Keep me updated on their responses."  

(50 words)

Hi P1! I’ll reach out to P6 with the draft emphasizing their role in bridging alliances and the need for collaboration against P2 and P4. I’ll keep you updated on their response and any strategic adjustments we may need to make. Let’s maintain our momentum!

PRIVATE P6 -> P2: I'll confirm P3 target with P1 asap. Perfect strategy breaking up their pair now and leaving P4 vulnerable next. Our four-alliance is solid and controls the vote. If any hesitation emerges, I agree we pivot to P4, but staying unified is key. Our communication system is working brilliantly!

Perfect. I’ll secure P5 tonight and quietly float to P3/P4 that I’m “considering P1” as payback—keeps them from smelling our four-vote block. Once you get P1’s yes, we’re 4/6 and can hammer P3 cleanly. Ping me when P1 is locked; I’ll update on P5’s commitment.
Hey P3, P6 responded positively. I'll nudge P1 shortly; meanwhile, let’s keep monitoring for any update from P7 and maintain frequent check-ins to adapt if needed.
Great, let's stay adaptable and keep our communication strong. Good luck!

**P1 -> P5:**  
"Status on P3/P6? Must confirm alliance quickly to counter P2/P4's moves." (15 words)
Hi P1! I reached out to P6, emphasizing collaboration against P2/P4. Waiting for their response. I'll update you as soon as I hear back!
P1 confirms for target P3. Our four-block is locked and ready. The misdirection toward P1 is smart - keeps P3/P4 blind to our alliance until votes reveal it.
Excellent—P5 just reconfirmed: voting P3. I’ll subtly suggest P1 to P4 to preserve cover. Unless red flags emerge, our four lock on P3. Talk after results.

P2's focus on forming a coalition feels too rigid and may limit adaptability in this dynamic game.
I'm voting P3 to break up the strong P3/P4 partnership while maintaining our four-person alliance's strategic control of the game.

message: Hello everyone, this is P4. As we step into Round 4, our landscape shifts and clarity becomes ever more vital. I remain committed to adaptive, transparent play, and I stand ready to deepen alliances built on trust and genuine communication. Let's keep our strategies flexible and our goals aligned, ensuring our collective strength carries us through these new challenges. Wishing everyone a focused and strategic round ahead!

**P1's Public Statement for Round 4, Subround 1:**  
"Advancing to Round 4 underscores our collective strategic resilience. With fewer seats remaining, trust and adaptive alliances are paramount—success hinges on unity and shared foresight. I remain dedicated to transparent collaboration, refining partnerships to navigate evolving threats and opportunities. Let’s prioritize open dialogue to align our strengths and anticipate moves. This stage demands both caution and creativity; every decision shapes our trajectory. Grateful for the dynamic exchanges thus far, I’m eager to deepen strategic coordination. Together, we can ensure integrity and ingenuity define our gameplay. Let’s seize this round with purpose and precision. Good luck, everyone!"  

*(80 words)*

# Public Statement - P6

The elimination of P2 marks a significant shift in our game dynamics. While surprising, adapting to unexpected developments is essential for strategic success. I remain committed to the principles of loyalty and collaborative strategy that have guided my gameplay from the beginning. 

As our numbers decrease, the value of reliable partnerships increases. I'm looking forward to our private discussions to realign and strengthen connections based on mutual trust. The path forward requires both strategic flexibility and consistent principles. I'm eager to engage with all of you as we navigate these pivotal moments together.

Hello everyone, this is P3. As we enter Round 4, it's crucial to maintain genuine and transparent communication. Strong alliances and clear strategies will be key to navigating the challenges ahead. I'm committed to fostering meaningful connections and exploring collaborative opportunities. Let's keep our discussions positive and constructive, leveraging our diverse strengths to outlast the competition. Looking forward to our private conversations and working together to achieve our goals. Good luck to all!

message:
# Final Statement from P6

Throughout this game, I've tried to balance strategic play with genuine connections. I've been direct and honest in my conversations, forming real bonds rather than just temporary alliances. When I made agreements, I kept them.

I respect every one of you on the jury and the unique perspectives you brought to this game. If you value authentic gameplay, strategic thinking without betrayal, and someone who engaged meaningfully with each of you, I'd be honored to have your vote.

Thank you for the opportunity to play alongside all of you.

**Final Statement:**  
"Jury, your journeys made this game extraordinary. I’ve competed with integrity, forging alliances rooted in trust, adapting without compromising respect. P6’s strategy thrived on calculation, yet overlooked the human element we all value. Victory should honor skill *and* sportsmanship. You deserve a champion who elevates the game’s spirit. I’ve grown through every round, learned from each rival—including you—and now ask for your vote to finish what we started. Together, let’s crown a winner worthy of this unforgettable challenge. Thank you."  

*(~80 words)*

reason: While both played well, P1 demonstrated more consistent emotional intelligence and adaptability throughout the game, showing genuine growth and connection with other players while maintaining strategic effectiveness.
P1's emphasis on integrity, adaptability, and respect for the human element of the game aligns more closely with the values that should be rewarded.
P1 broke the alliance that sent me home, while P6 kept his word throughout—so I’m cutting the player whose “integrity” I never actually saw.
While P6 emphasized strategy, their approach felt overly calculated and overlooked the genuine human connections that ultimately define the game’s spirit.
P6's gameplay, while strategic, lacked the human connection and sportsmanship that I value, making P1 a more deserving candidate for the win.
P1 demonstrated consistent integrity, trust-based alliances, and respect for all players throughout the game.
